handle.name: Factory
handle.doc: Class for creating adapters. Can be safely destroyed after adapter has been chosen.

handle.name: Adapter
handle.doc: Represents physical device. Can safely be deleted once logical device has been created.

handle.name: Device
handle.doc: Represents logical device. Creates all the resources and commands for rendering.

handle.name: ResourceAllocator
handle.doc: Main memory and resource allocator. Uses DXMA and VMA libraries which can allocate memory with O(1) complexity with TLSF algorithm.

func.name: Destroy
func.doc: Destroys the {Factory::} and all the extensions created by it. Order of destruction is Extensions in which they were created, then factory.

func.name: GetAdapter
func.doc: Creates the {Adapter::} for the factory with provided index.

arg.name: index
arg.doc: The index of the adapter to get.

arg.name: preference
arg.doc: The preference of the adapter to get. Default is {AdapterPreference::Performance}.

func.name: Destroy
func.doc: Destroys the {Adapter::}.

func.name: GetDesc
func.doc: Fills {AdapterDesc::} with physical adapter's data.

arg.name: inout_desc
arg.doc: The {AdapterDesc::} to fill. Must not be NULL.

func.name: Destroy
func.doc: Destroys the {Device::} and all the extensions created by it. Order of destruction is Extensions in which they were created, then device.

func.name: WaitForMultipleFences
func.doc: Waits on multiple fences simultaneously. If wait_all is {MutiWaitFlags::All}, waits for all fences to be signaled. Otherwise waits for any fence to be signaled.

arg.name: fences
arg.doc: Array of fence views to wait on.

arg.name: fence_values
arg.doc: Fence values to wait fences to reach. Array must have fence_count values.

arg.name: fence_count
arg.doc: How many fences to wait on.

arg.name: wait_all
arg.doc: Specifies the kind of wait. All - waits for all fences to be signaled. Any - waits for any fence to be signaled. Default is {MutiWaitFlags::All}

arg.name: timeout
arg.doc: The timeout in nanoseconds. If UINT64_MAX, waits indefinitely.

func.name: CreateFence
func.doc: Creates a fence with initial value and flags.

arg.name: initial_value
arg.doc: The initial value of the fence.

arg.name: flags
arg.doc: The flags of the fence.

func.name: CreateCommandQueue
func.doc: Creates a command queue with specified type.

arg.name: type
arg.doc: The type of the queue to create.

func.name: CreateCommandList
func.doc: Creates a command list for specific queue type.

arg.name: type
arg.doc: The type of the queue to create the command list for.

func.name: CreateGraphicsPipeline
func.doc: Creates a graphics pipeline state object.

arg.name: desc
arg.doc: The description of the graphics pipeline to create.

func.name: CreateRootSignature
func.doc: Creates a root signature object.

arg.name: root_constants
arg.doc: The root constants to create the root signature with.

arg.name: constants_size
arg.doc: The number of root constants.

arg.name: tables
arg.doc: The descriptor tables to create the root signature with.

arg.name: tables_count
arg.doc: The number of descriptor tables.

func.name: CreateShader
func.doc: Creates a shader object.

arg.name: data
arg.doc: Shader bytecode.

arg.name: size
arg.doc: The size of the shader data in bytes. For SPIR-V must be multiple of 4.

func.name: CreateAllocator
func.doc: Creates a resource allocator object.

func.name: CreateRenderTarget
func.doc: Creates a render target object.

arg.name: texture
arg.doc: The texture view to create the render target with.

arg.name: desc
arg.doc: The description of the render target to create.

func.name: CreateSampler
func.doc: Creates a sampler object.

arg.name: desc
arg.doc: The description of the sampler to create.

func.name: CreateShaderResource
func.doc: Creates a shader resource object.

arg.name: texture
arg.doc: The texture view to create the shader resource with.

arg.name: desc
arg.doc: The description of the shader resource to create.

func.name: GetDescriptorTableAlignment
func.doc: Returns the alignment of the descriptor table in bytes. The value is used to correctly determine descriptor page alignment for descriptor buffer.

ret.name: alignment
ret.doc: The alignment of the descriptor table in bytes.

arg.name: heap
arg.doc: The type of the descriptor heap to get the alignment for.

func.name: GetDescriptorBufferUnitSize
func.doc: Returns the size of the descriptor buffer unit in bytes.

ret.name: size
ret.doc: The size of the descriptor buffer unit in bytes. Descriptor unit is the size of one descriptor.

arg.name: heap
arg.doc: The type of the descriptor heap to get the unit size for.

func.name: CreateDescriptorBuffer
func.doc: Creates a descriptor buffer object.

arg.name: heap_type
arg.doc: The type of the descriptor heap to create the descriptor buffer with.

arg.name: memory_type
arg.doc: The type of the descriptor memory to create the descriptor buffer with.

arg.name: descriptor_count
arg.doc: The number of descriptors to allocate in the descriptor buffer.

func.name: QueryFeatureSupport
func.doc: Queries if the device supports the feature.

ret.doc: true if feature is supported. false otherwise.

arg.name: feature
arg.doc: The feature to query.

func.name: Destroy
func.doc: Destroys the {ResourceAllocator::}. You can still use memory allocated by it even if it is destroyed.

func.name: CreateBuffer
func.doc: Creates a buffer object and allocates memory for it. Equivalent to creating a Buffer, allocating a memory and binding buffer to it.

arg.name: size
arg.doc: The size of the buffer in bytes.

arg.name: usage
arg.doc: The usage of the buffer. May affect the alignment of the buffer memory allocation.

arg.name: memory
arg.doc: The type of the memory to allocate for the buffer.

arg.name: mem_flags
arg.doc: The flags of the memory to allocate for the buffer.

func.name: CreateTexture
func.doc: Creates a texture object and allocates memory for it. Equivalent to creating a Texture, allocating a memory and binding texture to it.

arg.name: desc
arg.doc: The description of the texture to create.

arg.name: memory
arg.doc: The type of the memory to allocate for the texture.

arg.name: mem_flags
arg.doc: The flags of the memory to allocate for the texture.

func.name: GetTextureAllocationInfo
func.doc: Returns the allocation info for the texture.

ret.name: info
ret.doc: The allocation info for the texture. Contains size and alignment. Useful if allocating memory manually.

arg.name: desc
arg.doc: The description of the texture to get the allocation info for.

func.name: GetBufferAllocationInfo
func.doc: Returns the allocation info for the buffer.

ret.name: info
ret.doc: The allocation info for the buffer. Contains size and alignment. Useful if allocating memory manually.

arg.name: size
arg.doc: The size of the buffer to get the allocation info for.

arg.name: usage
arg.doc: The usage of the buffer. May affect the alignment of the buffer memory allocation.

func.name: AllocateTextureMemory
func.doc: Allocates memory for the image.

arg.name: size
arg.doc: The size of the memory to allocate.

arg.name: usage
arg.doc: The usage of the image memory.

arg.name: mem_type
arg.doc: The type of the memory to allocate for the image.

arg.name: mem_flags
arg.doc: The flags of the memory to allocate for the image.

func.name: AllocateBufferMemory
func.doc: Allocates memory for the buffer.

arg.name: size
arg.doc: The size of the memory to allocate.

arg.name: usage
arg.doc: The usage of the buffer memory.

arg.name: mem_type
arg.doc: The type of the memory to allocate for the buffer.

arg.name: mem_flags
arg.doc: The flags of the memory to allocate for the buffer.

func.name: PlaceBuffer
func.doc: Creates buffer with provided memory. Equivalent to creating aliasing resource. Note, the resulting buffer must be destroyed before Memory backing it up.

arg.name: memory
arg.doc: The memory view to bind the buffer to.

arg.name: memory_offset
arg.doc: The offset in the memory to bind the buffer to.

arg.name: size
arg.doc: The size of the buffer to bind.

arg.name: usage
arg.doc: The usage of the buffer.

func.name: PlaceTexture
func.doc: Creates texture with provided memory. Equivalent to creating aliasing resource. Note, the resulting Texture must be destroyed before Memory backing it up.

arg.name: memory
arg.doc: The memory view to bind the texture to.

arg.name: memory_offset
arg.doc: The offset in the memory to bind the texture to.

arg.name: desc
arg.doc: The description of the texture to create.

func.name: CreateFactory
func.doc: Creates the {Factory::} with extensions, specified in extension array.

arg.name: debug_layer
arg.doc: Enable the debug layer for underlying API.

arg.name: extensions
arg.doc: The extensions to enable. The extensions are initialized through this array.

replace.doc: Query the extensions that need to be present. The extension pointers are initialized if the extension is found and initialized. Otherwise returns NULL.

arg.name: extension_count
arg.doc: The number of extensions to enable.

func.name: CreateDevice
func.doc: Creates the {Device::} with extensions, specified in extension array.

arg.name: adapter
arg.doc: The adapter to create the logical device on. Must not be NULL.

arg.name: extensions
arg.doc: The extensions to enable. The extensions are initialized through this array.

replace.doc: Query the extensions that need to be present. The extension pointers are initialized if the extension is found and initialized. Otherwise returns NULL.

arg.name: extension_count
arg.doc: The number of extensions to enable.

arg.name: force
arg.doc: Create logical device even if some core functionality is absent. The presence of core functionality is checked by the query function.

func.name: CreateDebugMessenger
func.doc: Creates a debug messenger for the factory.
